sources.title: 1934 Romantic Comedy - Old Judge Priest - Lessons of a bygone era wrapped in Southern justice
sources.description:
Judge Priest is a 1934 American comedy film starring Will Rogers. The film was directed by John Ford, and based on humorist Irvin S. Cobb's character Judge Priest.

A warm yet controversial tale of small-town justice, Judge William 'Billy' Priest, is a folksy judge navigating courtroom antics, family drama, and community tensions in a nostalgic 1890s Southern town.

Main Actors:
Will Rogers - Judge William 'Billy' Priest
Tom Brown - Jerome Priest
Anita Louise - Ellie May Gillespie
Henry B. Walthall - Reverend Ashby Brand
David Landau - Bob Gillis
Rochelle Hudson - Virginia Maydew
Roger Imhof - Billy Gaynor
Frank Melton - Flem Talley
Charley Grapewin - Sergeant Jimmy Bagby
Berton Churchill - Senator Horace Maydew
Brenda Fowler - Mrs. Caroline Priest
Francis Ford - Juror No. 12
Hattie McDaniel - Aunt Dilsey
Stepin Fetchit - Jeff Poindexter

Release date: September 28, 1934
Filming location: Kentucky (setting), filmed in California

Black & White version: https://youtu.be/Rsvi-AeIcF0

This film is available with English & Spanish audio, and subtitled in many language options


https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=UUMOycDFnpMeWzaITQSD1dWsOA

@CultCinemaClassics
@CultCinemaClassics

metadata.Plot: A successful playwright employs a new female writing partner, and it's love on first sight, but it happens to be the day he gets married. They both suppress their feelings for each other in order to form a successful writing partn...
metadata.Actors: Dudley Moore, Mary Steenburgen, Frances Sternhagen
